summary: This bill, the Requiring Enhanced and Accurate Lists of Health Providers Act (REAL Health Providers Act), aims to improve the accuracy of provider directories for Medicare Advantage plans. It mandates MA organizations to maintain accurate, publicly accessible directories, verify provider information regularly, and remove inaccurate listings. It also establishes cost-sharing protections for enrollees who rely on incorrect directory information. Furthermore, the bill requires analyses of directory accuracy, publicly reports the scores, and provides funding for the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services. Finally, it calls for stakeholder meetings and guidance to improve directory maintenance.
